intro: Trichera collina subsp. subscaposa, commonly known as the slender trichera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in shrubland and open woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are showy and usually pink or red. The subspecies is distinguished by its slender stem and reduced leaf stalks, giving it a unique appearance among related species.
